description: This trap is generated when the POS function is started or stopped.
This attribute controls the starting or stoppage of POS access function.
The defalut value is disabled(1).
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaServerEnable

description: This trap is generated whenever the availability of application server
changes.
The identification of a POS application.
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaAppID

description: This is a dummy MIB object referenced by the hh3cPosaAppStateChange trap.
This object shows the availability changing of corresponding application
server.
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaAppStateChangeObject

description: This trap is generated whenever the POS connection through a FCM (Fast
Connection Modem) interface is hanged up by POS terminal.

event.Summary: POS connection is hanged up by its terminal

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaTerminalHangUp IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: This trap is generated whenever the link layer negotiation is failed
between the POS terminal and router through a FCM (Fast Connection
Modem) interface.

event.Summary: Link layer negotiation failed between POS terminal and router

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaFcmLinkNegoFailed IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: This trap is generated whenever the physical layer negotiation is failed
between the POS terminal and router through a FCM (Fast Connection
Modem) interface.

event.Summary: Physical layer negotiation failed between POS terminal and router

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaFcmPhyNegoFailed IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: This trap is generated whenever the number of connections exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: Number of TCP connections exceeded the threshold $v1

description: The threshold of TCP connections.
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaTcpConnectionThreshold

description: This trap is generated whenever the number of connections exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: Number of FCM connections exceeded the threshold $v1

description: The threshold of FCM connections.
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaFcmConnectionThreshold

description: This trap is generated whenever the number of trades in any TCP connect exceeds
the limit.

event.Summary: Number of trades in any TCP connect exceeded the limit $v1

description: The limit of concurrent trades in one TCP connection. The value 0
means unlimited.
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaTcpTradeLimit

description: The identification of a POS terminal.
variables.name: HH3C-POSA-MIB::hh3cPosaTerminalID
